text: This will be interesting, ready?
Eh, that was good! No, that did not sound Portuguese at all!
I thought I would give it a go after our experience in LA a couple of weeks back.
The point of the trip was to meet new foodies... We've ruined our friendship, we have a purely professional relationship now.
We need to find new people to cook with!
And we did in the form or RoleGourmet
Otavio and PC, they are a Brazilian food channel and we got the chance to cook with them! Check it out
I would love to explain what's going on, but I've got absolutely no idea!
My English is not that nice, if you can't understand what I'm saying it's because I'm drunk!
Caipirinha is good
Haha yes Capriana!

How do you say it?
Caipirinha
Cai-piri-nha
This is probably a very different style of cooking from anything we've ever done before
Oh really? Why do you say that?
Because I know how to cook, man!
There you go!
That's what it is!!
Ben just mixes things up
Come on, I can cook for real!
Yep, he can cook for real
Not a single regret
Do you know what I remember most about that trip?
You being in LA and me freezing my nuts off here in the UK
If you know of any really cool foodies that we should get in touch with, then let us know
because we're up for doing as many collaborations as possible
If you want to watch us in their video then click up here somewhere, I'm not sure... Where are you going to put it Mike?

I don't know, I think I might go...
There
Just keep it simple!
There
There
But don't panic if your Portuguese isn't as fluent as mine, which obviously is...

Probably not fluent at all!
Ahem, Google Translate
You can follow along anyway as Otavio has translated it all into English subtitles

What a legend!
And he's taken a handful of our recipes and translated them
into Portuguese so if you're new from Role Gourmet, you can also enjoy these

They'll be linked in the description box below.
I'm looking forward to watching that translated video as well
Because you don't look like you have a clue what they are saying.
I reckon they're saying
"Hi, today we're cooking with these dweebs, they're idiots and don't know anything about food, we're just going to talk in Portuguese, confuse them and make them look stupid!
Mike are you saying you don't speak Portuguese?

I wear make-up!
Explains a lot
Really does, doesn't it?
Why what does that mean?
On the topic of dating, this week we cooked with Zoe Hardman
We cooked Heuvos Rancheros, and she offered to ask Paddy to get me on Take Me Out!
So... Win!

Obviously, first round, down the lift...
Red, red, red, red, red
Gone!
For our Jamie Oliver recipe, we made Chunky Chilli Con Carne,
Which he, the man himself came and rated Ben for at the end, he tasted it and everything.

You were sweating because 
The pressure was on!
It was with smashed roots, so a low carb version

Didn't he compare me to a...
An accountant
An insurance salesman
Yeah... I think that was a backhanded compliment!
Yeah...
And what did you make on TasteMade this week Mike?

Well Barry, I made Braised Beef and Pappardelle
Ooo it sounds delicious!
Yes it was!
Homemade pasta
An impressive dish that I'm going to use on all my dates

That I'm going to get sometime in the future
I think you can get a date
Especially if you use our White Chocolate Road

As a gift to entice in your Valentine
Well linked!
We also did that this week

If you want to date Mike, then just let us know
If you know any really good Russian Mail Order Bride websites

Just put them in the link below!
I'm not some sort of cheap prostitute

Debatable!
Also this week on SORTED Food...
Ok ok, so yes I've made another mistake.
This week's recipe isn't what Barry's about to to talk about because the correct recipe is
Turkey Meatball Tray Bake
and here is a massive picture of it
Click it for a video of how to make it

now we know that the mistakes over the
last couple of weeks
Haven't adhered to SORTED's usual high standards and you... well
you deserve better
And we are truly truly

sorry.
So far this week we've had Feijoada from Brazil,
we've had Huevos Rancheros, a Mexican dish
We've had Pappardelle, which is Italian

And now for some Korean food.
Finish it off.
A couple of weeks ago we were at a student festival, a live event
doing demos and somebody, Suji, came up to us and gave us some amazing
Korean snacks

so we thought we would give them a little bit of a taste.
We're going to rate them with our ignorant
Western thoughts
Cuttle Fish flavoured snacks
A bit like Prawn Crackers
from China, but made from Cuttle Fish

They are fishy crisps.
They're like prawn crackers
They are! They're delicious
Ah yeah! Then we've got
Marine Boy

What's that?
Marine Boy
Puffed snacks in the shape of starfish, fish, squid, shark

crab, turtle, octopus, and whale 
Oh, and blowfish... Would you like a blowfish?

Give us one!
Salty, almost like pickled vinegar
Pickled vinegar?
All vinegar is pickled!
Pickled onion!

I don't know!
Something sweet
Mine is moist chewy cake
is called
Bungeoppang... I think!
Bungeoppang... These smell really sweet
Ah it's got chocolate in the middle
Did you check the expiry date on these?
No... Suji wouldn't do that to us
Choco Boy!
from Orion
Meaning Chocolate Mushrooms
sweet biscuit with chocolate
Oh yeah

Oh yeah
The point is, these are all brand new to us
and we'd love to see more stuff from around the world, so if you guys have got snacks
sweet or savoury that are native to where you're from, we'd love to see photos of them
Send them to us on Instagram, hashtag #SORTEDFood so we get to see them
I think it's safe to say that Korean snacks are delicious!

Thank you very much Suji!
We have talked about a whole load of things, make sure you go and check out
the Feijoada video, the website to get all of the recipes you've missed this week

And let us know of any other foodie channels out there that you want us to get in touch with
Yeah, definitely

Otherwise, we will see you next week
Onwards and upwards
Have a beautiful week
Au Revoir
See ya
Bye bye
